oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SGT Christopher Ammons on his last patrol in Qui Nhon
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: SGT Christopher Ammons, pictured on his last patrol in Vietnam, appears to be fully armed. He is wearing a soft hat commonly called a "boonie" or "bush hat." This one has a fabric tape band of branch loops around the crown. These loops are meant to hold additional vegetation as camouflage.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Soldiers
Ammons, Christopher D., 1948- ; Vietnam War, 1961-1975; United States. Army. Military Police Company, 194th; Vung Chua Mountain (Vietnam); Qui Nhon (Vietnam)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: After an earlier tour in Vietnam in 1967, Ammons returned to Vietnam for a second tour in 1969. This time he was assigned to the 194th MP Company (attached to the 1st Signal Brigade), which was serving as a security force on Vung Chua Mountain near the city of Qui Nhon on the South China Sea coast.
